results.title: head_phone_film_poems
results.brief_description:
head_phone_film_poems is a collection of thirteen films that creatively remix material from online archives including the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO) film material in the National Archives of Australia, crime scene photographs from the Justice and Police Museum Sydney, and Gibson’s own social-media-stored collection of strange late-night phenomena filmed in his neighbourhood over the past decade. Drawing on these caches of ‘readymade’ footage, the head_phone_film_poems are shaped by three guiding principles: they must be produced entirely on the iPhone, they must feature some visualised language and they must suggest an enormous amount more than they show.

[Sourced from ACMI website event page https://www.acmi.net.au/whats-on/ross-gibson-head_phone_film_poems/ 9/6/2021]

results.title: Castleguard Cave
results.creator_credit: Syd Perov, Derek Ford, Haverand Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adventure film of a different sort - the fascinating record of the exploration of Castleguard Cave under the Columbia Icefield in Banff National Park, an exhausting but irresistible crawl through more than 5 km of dark tunnel, the longest known in Canada. What beckons the members of the expedition, what they find, how they support the physical stress, the nagging doubts, and what their reward is - these are all questions they answer in this film. Award: Milton Keynes, England

results.title: Synthing
results.brief_description: Synthing is the result of years of exploratory work across disciplines. “The Synthing concept puts expressive and energetic body movement in front of a video camera interface to create an engrossing interplay of music and images within the framework of a cybermedium… a synaesthetic compositional tool”, says Gruchy. Synthing, through its use of real-time navigation and interactive technologies, allows real opportunities for audience interaction.

results.title: Ron's story
results.creator_credit: Davide Grassi, Aldo Ivancic and Ron Athey
results.brief_description: Ron’s Story is a video based on the work and obsessions of Los Angeles-based extreme performance artist Ron Athey. The video is comprised of footage filmed at various performances staged at the Kapelica Gallery and the Cultural Centre Cankarjev dom in Ljubljana between 1996 and 2001.

results.title: Nuclear body
results.brief_description:
A project by Davide Grassi, Nuclear Body is the result of research into one of the diagnostic techniques used in the field of nuclear medicine: radio-isotopic scanning or schintigraphy. This technique allows the evaluation of a body organ’s state by rendering on a computer monitor a digital image of it. An isotope, introduced intravenously into the patient, after reaching the target organ starts to emit gamma rays, which are than detected by a special gamma camera. By following this procedure methodically, the whole artist’s body was “copied” and “pasted” into a virtual dimension. In Nuclear Body, Grassi utilises schintigraphy not simply as a diagnostic technique, but as a means by which to create a virtual double of a body which could be used in digital environments.

The project was realised in partnership with the Oncological Institute of Ljubljana’s Clinic Centre, and was supported by the Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Slovenia and the City of Ljubljana’s Cultural Department. It was premiered in March 1999 at the Ljubljana’s Cultural and Congress Centre Cankarjev dom in the frame of the festival “the Beauty of Extreme II”.

[ text edited from www.cd-cc.si/kultura/grassi/intro.htm ]

results.title: J.P.McGowan
results.creator_credit: Scott Murray, Paul Kallina and Julie Marlow
results.brief_description: Born in Terowrie, South Australia, J.P.McGowan acted in more than 270 films, many of which he directed, including the acclaimed serial The Hazards of Helen. The first Australian actor and director to ever break in to Hollywood, his film work is regarded as some of the most skilful of the period, and exists in the hands of several dedicated collectors across the globe. A pioneer Australian film maker, McGowan has left an important international legacy. This half hour film documenting the Terowrie celebration of his life, and illustrating the little known life and career of J.P.McGowan is a marvellous addition to Australian film culture. There is a large extant collection of McGowan’s work, clips from which will be sourced for inclusion in the film. The filmmakers will be in touch with the major collectorof McGowan’s work in Adelaide; and there may be an opportunity to acquire the best of it for ACMI collections

results.title: Of day of night
results.brief_description: This experimental interactive CD-ROM explores the intersections of narrative, subjectivity and interactivity. A hybrid of cinematic, textual and interactive elements, it finds resonances between dream experience and the unexpected associations inherent in new media forms. A map of sorts. A handful of objects. A problem with dreaming. Found objects and their imagined traces and histories assist a woman who has a problem with dreaming.

results.title: I am a singer
results.brief_description: This award winning interactive CD-Rom weaves a fragmentary narrative about an amnesiac famed for her singing. Exploring notions of performance, autobiography and memory this is an intriguing and compelling story in which the viewer helps to reconstruct the events of a life lived through song.

results.title: The Hitch
results.brief_description:
A driver picks up a hitchhiker on a deserted country road but it seems neither of them knows what lies ahead.

‘The Hitch’ was shot over 6 days in the outer suburbs of Sydney, Australia. Almost all cast and crew donated their time. The budget was approximately $20,000.

results.title: Lazy Sunday afternoon
results.brief_description: In the desert a vulture enjoys the silence of a hot afternoon. The sudden appearance of a vehicle destroys the quiet of the day. Two pistoleros exit the car ready for a duel; our hero, the vulture, watches as the pistoleros take part in a very funny slow motion shoot-out.
